revised_title: The Role of Lymph Corpuscles in the Absorption of Nutrients and the Origin of Proteids in Chyle
tldr: The author investigates the role of lymph corpuscles in the absorption of nutrients, particularly fats, in the small intestine. They demonstrate that these cells play a crucial role in the transference of food materials from the intestinal epithelium to the lacteals, and that they disintegrate and dissolve in the chyle, releasing proteins and other nutrients.
